revised_title: Carbohydrate Transformations in the Animal System: A New Line of Research
tldr: The author presents a new line of research on the physiology of carbohydrates in the animal system, focusing on the transformation of carbohydrates by the action of ferments and chemical agents. They demonstrate the passage of carbohydrates in the opposite direction, converting glucose into a body with the same cupric oxide reducing power as maltose, and cane-sugar into maltose, rather than glucose. This research also shows the presence of ferments in the alimentary canal, circulatory system, and liver that play a role in these transformations.
